title: Why North Korea is sending soldiers to the Russian front lines
description: South Korea has urged Russia to take “immediate” action to withdraw North Korean troops, as Kim Jong Un seeks to strengthen the alliance between Moscow and Pyongyang.
author: Michelle Lee
excerpt: South Korea has urged Russia to take “immediate” action to withdraw North Korean troops, as Kim Jong Un seeks to strengthen the alliance between Moscow and Pyongyang.
text: SEOUL — South Korean and Ukrainian officials are raising the alarm about reports of North Korean troops supporting Russians inside Ukraine, warning that the alliance between Moscow and Pyongyang is growing stronger and evolving beyond transferring weapons.“We see that the alliance between Russia and such regimes as the North Korean one is getting stronger,” Zelensky said in his Oct. 13 video address. “This is not just about the transfer of weapons; this is in fact about the transfer of people from North Korea to the armed forces of the occupiers.”
html:
SEOUL — South Korean and Ukrainian officials are raising the alarm about reports of North Korean troops supporting Russians inside Ukraine, warning that the alliance between Moscow and Pyongyang is growing stronger and evolving beyond transferring weapons.

“We see that the alliance between Russia and such regimes as the North Korean one is getting stronger,” Zelensky said in his Oct. 13 video address. “This is not just about the transfer of weapons; this is in fact about the transfer of people from North Korea to the armed forces of the occupiers.”
